chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A B) (vec A C)) (double (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)))) pi

Premises:
*** [ plus : AV -> AV -> AV ]
*** [ cons : V -> V -> AV ]
*** [ PO : Type ]
*** [ vec : PO -> PO -> V ]
*** [ pi : AV ]
*** [ R : AV -> AV -> Prop ]
isocele = fun A B C : PO => R (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)) (cons (vec C A) (vec C B)) : PO -> PO -> PO -> Prop
double = fun a : AV => plus a a : AV -> AV
somme_triangle : forall A B C : PO, R (plus (cons (vec A B) (vec A C)) (plus (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)) (cons (vec C A) (vec C B)))) pi
opp_vect : forall A B : PO, vR (opp (vec A B)) (vec B A)
v_vec : forall (u : V) (A : PO), exists B : PO, vR u (vec A B)
non_vide_P : exists A : PO, A = A
ssreflect.locked : forall A : Type, A -> A
BinNatDef.N.iter : BinNums.N -> forall A : Type, (A -> A) -> A -> A
Inductive clos_trans_1n (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t1n_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x y | t1n_trans : forall y z : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_trans _%type_scope
Refl.make_impl : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop -> Prop
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.iter = fun (A : Type) (f : A -> A) => fix iter_fix (x : A) (n : BinNums.positive) {struct n} : A := match n with | BinNums.xI n' => f (iter_fix (iter_fix x n') n') | BinNums.xO n' => iter_fix (iter_fix x n') n' | BinNums.xH => f x end : forall A : Type, (A -> A) -> A -> BinNums.positive -> A Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.iter {A}%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%positive_scope
somme_pi : forall u v w : V, R (plus (cons u v) (plus (cons w (opp u)) (cons (opp v) (opp w)))) pi
oppu_v : forall u v : V, R (cons (opp u) v) (plus pi (cons u v))
Refl.make_impl_true : forall (A : Type) (eval : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Refl.make_impl eval l True
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
ssrbool.mem = fun (T : Type) (pT : ssrbool.predType T) => let '{| ssrbool.pred_sort := pred_sort; ssrbool.topred := toP |} as pT0 := pT return (ssrbool.pred_sort pT0 -> ssrbool.mem_pred T) in fun A : ssrbool.pred_sort {| ssrbool.pred_sort := pred_sort; ssrbool.topred := toP |} => ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x : T => toP A x) : forall (T : Type) (pT : ssrbool.predType T), ssrbool.pred_sort pT -> ssrbool.mem_pred T Arguments ssrbool.mem {T}%type_scope {pT} A : rename, simpl never
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z
Chasles_2 : forall u v w t : V, R (cons u t) (plus (cons u v) (plus (cons v w) (cons w t)))
oppu_u : forall u : V, R (cons (opp u) u) pi
angle_plat : forall u : V, R (cons u (opp u)) pi
Chasles : forall u v w : V, R (plus (cons u v) (cons v w)) (cons u w)
zero_plus : forall u v : V, R (plus zero (cons u v)) (cons u v)
plus_zero : forall u v : V, R (plus (cons u v) zero) (cons u v)
permute : forall u v : V, R (plus (cons u v) (cons v u)) zero
u_oppv : forall u v : V, R (cons u (opp v)) (plus (cons u v) pi)
reflexion : forall i u v u' v' : V, R (cons u' i) (cons i u) -> R (cons v' i) (cons i v) -> R (cons u v) (cons v' u')
regulier_cons : forall u v w t s : V, R (cons u v) (cons u w) -> R (cons u t) (cons u s) -> R (cons v t) (cons w s)
rotation : forall u v u' v' : V, R (cons u u') (cons v v') -> R (cons u v) (cons u' v')
R_permute : forall u v w t : V, R (cons u v) (cons w t) -> R (cons v u) (cons t w)
Field_theory.Fnorm : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Field_theory.FExpr C -> Field_theory.linear C
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_theory.morph0 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> req (phi cO) rO
Ring_theory.morph1 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> req (phi cI) rI
Ring_polynom.ring_rw_pow_correct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe) (Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp cO cI ceqb phi Cp_phi rpow get_sign l npe)
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
Field_theory.split : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Field_theory.rsplit C
Field_theory.NPEmul : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Field_theory.NPEpow : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> BinNums.N -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
vR_R_compatible : forall u u' v v' : V, vR u u' -> vR v v' -> R (cons u v) (cons u' v')

original: simpl. intros. apply somme_triangle. apply H.
